授業目的: This course allows a student with a high level of Japanese language ability (completion of level 6 and above) to earn credits by working at a local public or private organization and writing a report based on that experience. Exchange students only.
到達目標: This course allows a student with a high level of Japanese language ability (completion of level 6 and above) to earn credits by working at a local public or private organization and writing a report based on that experience. Exchange students only.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Before registering for this course, the student must consult with the course supervisor to discuss the expectations for the internship. The supervisor will then work with the Center for International Education and Cooperation (CIEC) staff to find an appropriate placement for the student. Some possibilities for internships include companies, local government agencies, social welfare service providers, non-governmental organizations, schools, religious organizations, and so on. 
As a rule, the supervisor will serve as a liaison between the organization and the student and provide guidance when necessary. At the end of the term, the student will submit a report based on observations made during the internship, following guidelines provided by the supervisor.

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: This is a credit/non-credit course. No grade will be given.
